Content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the Air Force has done a yeoman service for the sovereignty and the territorial integrity of the country for 68 years. The President said this while addressing the 68th Anniversary of the Air Force. The 68th Anniversary of Sri Lanka Air Force was held at Hingurakgoda Air Force Base under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena. Air Force Commander Kapila Jayampathi welcomed the President at the Air Force Base. A special Guard of Honor by the Air Force was accorded to the President. Thereafter the President opened the exhibition and carnival, Air Tattoo 2019 organized in connection with the 68th Anniversary of the Air Force. The President made an observation tour of the premises. He specially observed the display stall on planting seeds from air. The President viewed the display stall of the training centre and he was presented with a book on training activities. The President also opened the new website of the Air Force. President Maithripala Sirisena said that he appreciated the services rendered by the Air Force for 68 years to protect sovereignty and territorial integrity of the country. The President expressed his gratitude to the families of war heroes and the disabled soldiers. He said that they are on par with their counterparts in the world. The President recalled the services of the Air Force during disasters to help the people. The Air Tattoo 2019 Exhibition and Carnival will be held from tomorrow to Wednesday. It will be opened to the public from 2.00 p.m. to midnight everyday free of charge. Chief of Defence Staff Admiral Ravindra Wijegunaratne, Army Commander Lieutenant General Mahesh Senanayaka and Senior Defence Officials were present on the occasion.
